item.title:
RT by @0xstark: my summary fwiw:
Agree: - cross-L2 interop is broken today 🤝 - we can and should move much faster ✅ - goal is simple – moving assets between chains with zero friction 🏆
Disagree: - we should put more resources into solving only "cluster interop"
imo the most ambitious + high leverage thing we can do is to bring the clusters together to find a pragmatic and efficient path to solving interop (months not years). It's a challenge. But can be achieved if driven by a balance of pragmatism and desire to achieve ambitious things for Ethereum. We can / must do it all.
PS: I think we actually mostly all on the same page here. But Twitter makes it seem like we aren't :) Which can drive a wedge into interop. Lots of respect and appreciation for Uma, Succinct, and everyone jumping into interop efforts!
